messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] the needle watcher
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, I ve read it--an enjoyable read. However, I wouldn t list it as a biography . It s historical fiction--you couldn t have dialogue in a biography of
messages.messageBody:
Yes, I've read it--an enjoyable read. However, I
wouldn't list it as a "biography". It's historical
fiction--you couldn't have dialogue in a biography of
someone who's been dead for 400 years. I'd pick it up,
if it interests you. It's more enjoyable than Samurai
William, in my opinion.

Nate

hello. I am wondering if anyone has read The Needle Watcher by
R.Blaker? its a biography of William Adams/Miura Anjin but im
unsure whether its worth getting.
anyone know about it? cheers
